<title level="1" right="Spell 5" pfs="Standard">[Blinding Foam](/Spells.aspx?ID=1279)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Acid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=3" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Incapacitation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=93" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Firebrands](/Sources.aspx?ID=196) pg. 88</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Two Actions" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You spray a colorful, caustic foam into the target's eyes, which clings to their face. Make a spell attack roll. If you hit, you deal 5d10 acid damage and 1d6 [persistent acid damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29), and the target is [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) for the duration. The foam can be removed with 3 Interact actions, which ends the persistent acid damage. These Interact actions don't need to be consecutive. When the target's persistent acid damage ends, the spell automatically ends.

---
**Heightened (8th)** The initial damage increases to 9d10, and the persistent acid damage increases to 2d6.
name: Blinding Foam
